texts.definition: Penalties given in games that only directly apply to one of the players.
markups: <style="Definition">Penalties given in games that only directly apply to one of the players.</style>
Specific penalties in games can affect either one or several players. Those that affect single players are <style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style>.

Penalties in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Sports">Sports</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ice%20Hockey">Ice Hockey</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Soccer">Soccer</link></style> are directed towards individual players. However, if this disqualifies them from participating in the game this of course affects the team as a whole also.

While players play together in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Left%204%20Dead%20series">Left 4 Dead series</link></style>, damage and being incapacitated affect individual players and some players may not complete a level while others do.

Designing <style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style> largely resembles designing <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style> in general but avoiding directly affecting other players (i.e. avoiding making them into <style="Link"><link="shared-penalties">Shared Penalties</link></style>). This can however become a somewhat blurred when affected players belong to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Alliances">Alliances</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style>. In <style="Link"><link="single-player-games">Single-Player Games</link></style> they are the only type of <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style>.

The specific effects of <style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style> can be the same as for <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style> in general. However, <style="Link"><link="downtime">Downtime</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="player-elimination">Player Elimination</link></style> directly affect specific players and thereby are individual in their nature. While the effects of <style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style> apply only to one players, other players can become involved in it by using <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player-Decided%20Distributions">Player-Decided Distributions</link></style>, either to decide which player should receive the <style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style> or to decide the specific effects of the <style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style>.

While <style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style> can be seen as the basic form of <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style>, it instead becomes a modification if one instead starts with the type of effect as a basis for <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style> can be used to form <style="Link"><link="social-dilemmas">Social Dilemmas</link></style> when used together with <style="Link"><link="individual-rewards">Individual</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="shared-rewards">Shared Rewards</link></style> (although the <style="Link"><link="individual-rewards">Individual Rewards</link></style> do not necessarily need to be directed towards the same player as the <style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style>).

The presence of <style="CurrentLink">Individual Penalties</style> affect players willingness to commit to <style="Link"><link="mutual-goals">Mutual Goals</link></style> (compared to <style="Link"><link="shared-penalties">Shared Penalties</link></style>). It also affects players' perceptions of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Risk/Reward">Risk/Reward</link></style> situations.
